attributes.action: invest more on community policing to reduce both crime and costs.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It costs £40,000 per year to lock up a criminal. Pay for a beat officer is between £20,000 and £30,000.

Estimating that one more member of the police force on the beat prevents two crimes a year, which would have resulted in a jail term, then a very substantial saving to the exchequer would be the outcome.

It is clear that in order to reduce crime and prison populations we need to invest more in our police force.

Crime prevention is very much better than cure.
